> Webarch [1] is pretty clear on the topic, though. Agents 
> should not infer properties from the URI, and "agents" 
> means both people and machines.

However, metaDataInURI-31 [2] which was finalized more recently than
WebArch[1] and was also referenced in WebArch is also very clear on the
topic:

	2.2 Guessing information from a URI
	...the ability to explore the Web informally and experimentally is
very 
	valuable, and Web users act on such guesses about URIs all the time.

	Many authorities facilitate such flexible use of the Web by
assigning 
	URIs in an orderly and predictable manner. Nonetheless, in the
example 
	above, Bob is responsible for determining whether the information 
	returned is indeed what he needs.

Is it possible that we have an ingrained view of URI Opacity that is
struggling with its evolvotion towards a more realistic and open-minded
stance?
